Package studentinfo.project3

Class DateTest

java.lang.Object
studentinfo.project3.DateTest
public class DateTest extends Object
This class tests the isValid() method of the Date class
Author:
David Fabian, Steven Tan

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    DateTest()
     

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    dayIsNotValid()
    Tests whether the day is a valid day Return false because specifically the day is not within the valid range as a positive integer less than or equal to 30 or 31, depending on the month.
    void
    doesNotHaveAThirtyFirst()
    Tests whether the month actually has a 31st day Method should return false since the day is the 31st while the month does not have 31 days in it.
    void
    isNotLeapDay()
    Tests whether the year is a leap year Method should return false for leap day (February 29th) since the year is not a leap year
    void
    monthHasThirtyOneDays()
    Tests whether the month has 31 days The method should return true if the day is the 31st only when the month has 31 days.
    void
    monthIsNotPositive()
    Tests whether the day is a valid day Return false because instance variables all must be within their corresponding ranges.
    void
    monthRangeIsNotValid()
    Tests whether the month is a valid month Return false because, specifically the month, is not within the valid range as a positive integer less than or equal to 12.
    void
    yearIsLeapYear()
    Tests whether the year is a valid leap year The method validates a date and return true if the date is leap day (2/29) and the year is divisible by 4 but not 100.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      public DateTest()

  • Method Details

    • isNotLeapDay

      public void isNotLeapDay()
      Tests whether the year is a leap year Method should return false for leap day (February 29th) since the year is not a leap year

    • doesNotHaveAThirtyFirst

      public void doesNotHaveAThirtyFirst()
      Tests whether the month actually has a 31st day Method should return false since the day is the 31st while the month does not have 31 days in it.

    • monthRangeIsNotValid

      public void monthRangeIsNotValid()
      Tests whether the month is a valid month Return false because, specifically the month, is not within the valid range as a positive integer less than or equal to 12.

    • dayIsNotValid

      public void dayIsNotValid()
      Tests whether the day is a valid day Return false because specifically the day is not within the valid range as a positive integer less than or equal to 30 or 31, depending on the month.

    • monthIsNotPositive

      public void monthIsNotPositive()
      Tests whether the day is a valid day Return false because instance variables all must be within their corresponding ranges. For months, it is between 1 and 12 inclusive.

    • yearIsLeapYear

      public void yearIsLeapYear()
      Tests whether the year is a valid leap year The method validates a date and return true if the date is leap day (2/29) and the year is divisible by 4 but not 100.

    • monthHasThirtyOneDays

      public void monthHasThirtyOneDays()
      Tests whether the month has 31 days The method should return true if the day is the 31st only when the month has 31 days.
